backend/main.mo: Motoko actor defining an application form submission system with types for career status, programs, and application forms, plus functions to submit, retrieve, and list applications stored in a map.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report confirming that 'compliance@stackteacher.com' was replaced with 'support@stackteacher.com' in the PrivacyPolicyPage frontend source file.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: JSON document containing one-line summaries of all frontend source files, describing their purpose and notable implementation details for build planning reference.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind CSS entry file defining OKLCH-based CSS custom properties for a light/dark color theme including background, foreground, chart, and sidebar tokens.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point setting the page title to 'AI Infrastructure Engineer Accelerator' and mounting the React app via the root div and main.tsx module script.
frontend/src/App.tsx: TanStack Router configuration defining all application routes including home, program landing pages, application form, about, terms, and privacy policy, wrapped in a shared Layout.
frontend/src/components/CareerDemandSect: Marketing section displaying US/Canada AI infrastructure salary ranges ($95K–$180K), a career growth image, and a no-coding-required callout card.
frontend/src/components/CareerServicesSe: Section listing six included career services (resume review, mock interviews, job strategy, LinkedIn, negotiation, career planning) in a card grid with a value statement.
frontend/src/components/CompaniesLogoSec: Section displaying a grid of six company names (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, etc.) with placeholder icons representing companies where graduates have interviewed.
frontend/src/components/CurriculumSectio: Section rendering the 8-month, four-phase curriculum (Tech Foundations, Cloud Engineering, Kubernetes, AI Integration) as a 2-column card grid with topics per phase.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsCar: Career services section specific to the data analytics program, listing six services (resume rewriting, LinkedIn, SQL prep, case studies, portfolio, post-program support) in a card grid.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsCur: Renders a 5-phase curriculum section for the Data Analytics program, displaying each phase as a card with topics and outcomes, with Phase 4 (AI Integration) visually highlighted.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsFAQ: Displays a FAQ accordion section with 6 common questions and answers about the Data Analytics program.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsFin: Final call-to-action section emphasizing Data+AI as a career baseline, with a button linking to the /apply route.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsHer: Hero section for the AI Data & Analytics Engineer Accelerator program, listing key skills with icons and a CTA button linking to /apply.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsOpp: Highlights the market opportunity for data professionals, listing key skills and displaying US salary ranges for three analytics roles in cards.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsPri: Justifies the $2,999 program price by contrasting what is not included (self-paced videos, tutorials) versus what is included (mentorship, projects, AI training) in a two-column card layout.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsPro: Displays the program format details (8-month duration, live sessions, labs, cohort size, etc.) as icon cards, with a note about selective admission.
Showcases five portfolio projects students will build during the program, each with an icon, title, and description in a card grid.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsTar: Describes the target audience for the program using icon cards for seven professional profiles, with a highlighted note that no math or coding background is required.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsWhy: Explains the program's rationale by listing five common problems with existing data courses using X-icon cards, concluding with a bold statement about fixing them.
frontend/src/components/DifferentiationS: Renders a section contrasting what the program is not (bootcamp, generic IT, self-paced videos) with what it is, using cards with X/Check icons.
frontend/src/components/FAQSection.tsx: Displays a collapsible accordion FAQ section with seven questions covering prerequisites, time commitment, job outcomes, and program differences.
frontend/src/components/FeaturedPrograms: Shows three featured program cards (Infrastructure, Data & Analytics, QA Automation) with badges, descriptions, and links to their respective pages.
Renders a final call-to-action section with Apply Now and Schedule a Call buttons, emphasizing limited seats and the AI infrastructure hiring boom.
frontend/src/components/FutureProofSecti: Highlights why infrastructure engineers are AI-proof by listing tasks AI cannot perform and emphasizing strategic thinking, problem-solving, and collaboration.
frontend/src/components/HeroSection.tsx: Hero section for the infrastructure program page featuring a headline, five core skill icons, and Apply Now/Download Curriculum CTA buttons.
frontend/src/components/HomeFAQSection.t: Compact home-page FAQ accordion with four questions covering beginner-friendliness, job guarantees, cohort language/timezone, and program differentiation.
Main home-page hero section with a headline targeting career switchers, program highlights, and Apply/Download Brochure CTA buttons.
frontend/src/components/HowItWorksSectio: Three-step process section (Apply, Learn & Build, Launch) with icons and CTA buttons linking to the apply page and a free call scheduler.
frontend/src/components/ImpactCountersSe: Displays four impact metrics (students enrolled, projects built, 1:1 hours, interview-ready grads) in a grid with large bold numbers.
frontend/src/components/InstructorSectio: Displays an instructor profile section with a photo and three credential cards highlighting certifications, real-world experience, and student success track record.
frontend/src/components/Layout.tsx: Root layout component providing a sticky header with navigation/program dropdown, a main content outlet, and a footer with a newsletter signup form and site links.
frontend/src/components/LeadCaptureSecti: Renders a lead capture form card that collects name, email, phone, and preferred call time, showing a success confirmation message upon submission.
frontend/src/components/PortfolioProject: Displays a grid of four portfolio projects (AI SaaS deployment, data pipeline, AI insights assistant, capstone) as image cards with titles, descriptions, and a GitHub link indicator.
frontend/src/components/PricingSection.t: Shows a single $2,999 pricing card listing eight included features, an ROI callout, and an Apply Now button linking to the apply route.
frontend/src/components/ProgramStructure: Presents six program structure highlights (duration, cohort model, limited seats, mentorship, recorded access, community) as icon cards, plus a program phases image.
Lists five real-world infrastructure projects (multi-region cloud, data pipeline, AI deployment, Kubernetes, CI/CD) as cards with icons, alongside two architecture images and a GitHub portfolio callout.
frontend/src/components/QACareerServices: Displays a 'Career Accelerator Layer' section with six QA-focused career services (resume writing, LinkedIn optimization, interview prep, mock interviews, behavioral coaching, 60-day job plan) as icon cards.
frontend/src/components/QACurriculumSect: Renders a 3-month QA program curriculum broken into weekly topics, AI labs, and projects using Card and Badge components. Each month displays its weeks with titles, topics, optional AI lab notes, and project milestones.
frontend/src/components/QAFAQSection.tsx: Displays a FAQ accordion section for the AI-Augmented QA program with five common questions and answers. Uses shadcn Accordion components in a centered max-width layout.
frontend/src/components/QAFinalCTASectio: Final call-to-action section urging users to apply for the QA cohort, featuring a headline, description, and a Button linking to the /apply route.
frontend/src/components/QAHeroSection.ts: Hero section for the QA program page with a gradient background, program title, a warning about AI replacing basic QA scripting, key feature icons, and an apply CTA button.
frontend/src/components/QAOpportunitySec: Explains the market opportunity for AI-augmented QA by contrasting what AI can already do versus what the program teaches, and displays US salary ranges in cards.
frontend/src/components/QAOutcomesSectio: Lists seven program learning outcomes as a grid of bordered cards with checkmark icons, summarizing what students will be able to do after 12 weeks.
frontend/src/components/QAPricingSection: Pricing section showing a $1,999 one-time investment card with a two-column comparison of what the program is not versus what it is, plus an apply CTA button.
frontend/src/components/QAProgramStructu: Displays program format details (duration, live sessions, projects, time commitment, cohort structure) as icon cards, with a note that the program requires active participation.
frontend/src/components/QAProjectsSectio: Showcases six portfolio deliverables graduates will produce (GitHub framework, API collection, CI pipeline, test docs, AI workflow example, capstone) in a card grid layout.
frontend/src/components/QATargetAudience: Renders a 'Who This Program Is For' section for a QA program, displaying a grid of 7 target audience cards with icons and a highlighted tagline at the bottom.
frontend/src/components/TargetAudienceSe: Renders a 'Who This Program Is For' section with a 2-column grid of 6 audience cards using checkmark icons, plus a 'No Prior Coding Experience Required' callout.
frontend/src/components/TestimonialsSect: Displays a 3-column grid of student testimonial cards with quotes, avatars, names, and roles for the Stack Teacher platform.
Renders a 3-column feature section highlighting cohort-based learning, career acceleration, and AI-integrated curriculum with icons and descriptions.
frontend/src/components/WhyStackTeacherS: Displays a grid of 5 differentiator cards explaining why learners choose Stack Teacher, each with a checkmark icon and descriptive text.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Custom hook that creates and caches an ICP backend actor (authenticated or anonymous) using React Query, and invalidates dependent queries when the actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useApplicationForm.ts: Custom hook that exposes a `submitApplication` mutation function wrapping the backend actor's `submitApplication` call, with loading and error state.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides an `InternetIdentityProvider` and `useInternetIdentity` hook for managing DFINITY Internet Identity authentication, including login, logout, and identity persistence.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Exports two React Query hooks—`useGetAllApplications` and `useGetApplication`—for fetching application data from the ICP backend actor.
frontend/src/index.css: Defines Tailwind CSS base styles and CSS custom properties for light and dark themes using OKLCH color values.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that mounts the React app wrapped with `QueryClientProvider` and `InternetIdentityProvider`.
frontend/src/pages/AboutPage.tsx: Renders the About page for Stack Teacher, describing the platform's mission, offerings, target audiences, AI-era capabilities, career services, and approach using various UI components and icons.
frontend/src/pages/ApplicationForm.tsx: Provides a multi-field application form for users to apply to a program, handling form state, validation, and submission via the useApplicationForm hook before navigating to a success page.
frontend/src/pages/ApplicationSuccess.ts: Displays a confirmation page after a successful application submission, outlining the next steps (review, interview, decision) and prompting the user to return home.
frontend/src/pages/DataAnalyticsLandingP: Composes the AI Data & Analytics Engineer Accelerator landing page by assembling all relevant section components in order.
frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx: Composes the main home page by assembling hero, features, programs, testimonials, FAQ, and other section components in sequence.
frontend/src/pages/LandingPage.tsx: Composes the AI Infrastructure Engineer Accelerator landing page by assembling all relevant section components in order.
frontend/src/pages/PrivacyPolicyPage.tsx: Renders the full Privacy Policy page with sections covering data collection, usage, cookies, and user rights, along with a sticky header linking back to the home page.
Composes the AI-Augmented QA Automation Engineer Program landing page by assembling all relevant QA-specific section components in order.
frontend/src/pages/TermsOfUsePage.tsx: React page component that renders the Stack Teacher Terms of Service, covering sections on terms, confidentiality, use license, and related legal content.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration defining custom colors (via CSS variables), font families, font sizes, border radii, box shadows, and accordion animations for the frontend.
project_state.json: Project state metadata for Stack Teacher at version 3, tracking an existing feature to replace 'compliance@stackteacher.com' with 'support@stackteacher.com' across all frontend source files.
